Race.SpecificTitle: PW Police Jury (Vet.) -- Disabled Vet. Homestead Exemp.-PJ
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Disabled Veterans Homestead Exemption)

Summary:  Authorizes an additional homestead exemption in the Parish of Webster, State of Louisiana, for certain disabled veterans and surviving spouses in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution.
Race.FullText: Shall an additional homestead exemption be authorized in the Parish of Webster, State of Louisiana, for certain disabled veterans and surviving spouses in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution, provided that this additional homestead exemption shall extend and apply to property in Webster Parish only after approval by a majority of the registered voters of Webster Parish voting on this proposition?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Minden -- 1.95 Mills - CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Minden Proposition
(Millage Continuation)

Summary:  Authority for the City of Minden to continue to levy a 10 year 1.95 mills property tax within the Downtown Development District of the City of Minden for administration, operational expenses, acquiring property by purchase, donation, exchange, or otherwise as the District may deem appropriate.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Minden, State of Louisiana, be authorized to continue to levy a special tax of one and ninety-five hundredths (1.95) mills on all property subject to taxation situated within the Downtown Development District of the City of Minden (the "District") as defined by Act 379 of 1990, as amended (the "Act") (an estimated $24,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2011 and ending with the year 2020, with the proceeds of said tax to be used solely and exclusively for the purposes and benefit of the District, and to be expended by the governing authority of the District for administration, operational expenses, acquiring property by purchase, donation, exchange, or otherwise as the District may deem appropriate, but not by expropriation, and/or the retirement of bonds or other evidences of indebtedness, in accordance with and subject to the terms and conditions of the Act?
